column4: i have an ubuntu machine which I use as a router - once it has very high uptime (around 100 days), I find that things become very slow, especially building the route table when links come up/go down, it takes several minutes - could anybody suggest why this is?
it shows as having about 179MB cahced, 5mb free, and 150mb active..
hmm. why would it happen gradually?
That's the first thing I thought.
any ideas on how to track down the culprit? :)
thats what I thought, but the only thing using any significant amount of memory is mysqld, using 8% of my memory, and 124mb of virtual memory
Then you just simply do not have enough memory.
Take it down, install more RAM.
It's the caching to the swap file that's slowing your system down.
fair enough. weird that it runs fine for around 100 days though =\
A few different services always end up consuming a little more memory over time, even when idle.
